decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The use hereby approved shall not be first occupied until revised plans showing a minimum of one long-stay bicycle parking space have first have been submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the local planning authority. The on-site transport infrastructure shall be provided before the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained and made available for the use of future occupiers of the development.
REASON: To ensure that adequate cycle parking provision is made support sustainable transport modes on site, and ensure car parking restraint, in accordance with paragraphs 32 & 35 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Policies 6.2, 6.3, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and Policy DM 42 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local.

Condition : 2 - The mitigation measures proposed in the submitted document Environmental Noise Impact Assessment dated 21st - 25th September [Report Ref: IMP5201-1] to control noise on site shall be implemented and maintained for the duration of the use, unless otherwise agree in writing with the local planning authority. 
REASON: To ensure that any noise from the use does not adversely affect the amenities of any neighbouring residential occupiers, in accordance with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies DM 1 and DM 38 of the Harrow Development Management Polices Local Plan (2013).
description: CONVERSION OF GROUND FLOOR OFFICES (CLASS B1) TO USE AS A STATE FUNDED SCHOOL OR NURSERY (PRIOR APPROVAL OF TRANSPORT & HIGHWAYS AND NOISE IMPACTS OF THE DEVELOPMENT AND OF CONTAMINATION RISKS ON THE SITE)
